tool.name: X!Tandem MSMS Search
tool.command:
#if $database.source_select=="built_in": rvm 1.9.3@protk-1.2.2 do tandem_search.rb -d $database.dbkey #else #rvm 1.9.3@protk-1.2.2 do tandem_search.rb -d $database.fasta_file #end if
--var-mods=' $variable_mods #for $custom_variable_mod in $custom_variable_mods: ,${custom_variable_mod.custom_mod} #end for '
--fix-mods=' $fixed_mods #for $custom_fix_mod in $custom_fix_mods: ,${custom_fix_mod.custom_mod} #end for '
$input_file -o $output -r --enzyme=$enzyme --precursor-ion-tol-units=$precursor_tolu -v $missed_cleavages -f $fragment_ion_tol -p $precursor_ion_tol $allow_multi_isotope_search --keep-params-files

param.name: input_file
param.label: MSMS File
param.help: An mzML file with MS/MS data

param.name: variable_mods
param.label: Variable Modifications
param.help: Hold the appropriate key while clicking to select multiple items

repeat.name: custom_variable_mods
repeat.title: Custom Variable Modifications
repeat.help: You can specify a modification when present in a motif. For instance, 0.998@N!{P}[ST] is a deamidation modification on N only if it is present in an N[any but P][S or T] motif (N-glycosite).

param.name: fixed_mods
param.label: Fixed Modifications
param.help: Hold the appropriate key while clicking to select multiple items

repeat.name: custom_fix_mods
repeat.title: Custom Fixed Modifications
repeat.help: You can specify a modification when present in a motif. For instance, 0.998@N!{P}[ST] is a deamidation modification on N only if it is present in an N[any but P][S or T] motif (N-glycosite).

param.name: missed_cleavages
param.help: Allow peptides to contain up to this many missed enzyme cleavage sites
param.label: Missed Cleavages Allowed

param.name: allow_multi_isotope_search
param.label: Allow multi-isotope search
param.help: This allows peptide candidates in windows around -1 Da and -2 Da from the acquired mass to be considered. Only applicable when the minus/plus window above is set to less than 0.5 Da. Good for accurate-mass instruments for which the reported precursor mass is not corrected to the monoisotopic mass.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Runs an MS/MS database search using the X!Tandem search engine. Output is in the form of a pepXML file containing identified peptides along with their raw search scores.
----
**References**
Please see http://www.thegpm.org/GPM/references.html for details of references describing the X!Tandem search engine.
